critique: This document is an executive order withdrawing land from settlement, location, sale, or entry and reserving it for public use. It references specific acts of Congress. There's no immediately obvious ideological tilt. It doesn't deal with immigration. It could be argued that reserving land for public use expands executive power, but it's also in accordance with existing legislation, so I'll mark it as neutral. It centralizes land control at the federal level. It doesn't directly address national security or civil liberties. Reserving land could be seen as moderate intervention. It doesn't seem to directly impact social inclusion.
